title: Bradley not worried about Scheffler, defends picks
content: U.S. captain Keegan Bradley defended his pairings picks and said he's not worried about Scottie Scheffler, who was winless in two matches Friday and will be in action again Saturday morning.

title: Rafaela's walk-off triple sends Red Sox to playoffs
content: Ceddanne Rafaela tripled to drive in the game-ending run in the ninth inning Friday night, giving the Red Sox a 4-3 victory over the Tigers and clinching Boston's first postseason berth since 2021.

title: Reds tie Mets for NL's 3rd and final wild-card spot
content: The Reds have put themselves in position to earn their first playoff berth since the pandemic-shortened 2020 season while keeping the free-spending Mets out of the postseason.

title: Virginia stuns No. 8 FSU in 2OT as fans storm field
content: Virginia held on for a 46-38 double-overtime win over No. 8 Florida State on Friday night, leading to a chaotic postgame scene in which fans rushed the field.

title: 49ers QB Purdy good to start after sitting out 2
content: After missing the past two games with a toe injury, 49ers quarterback Brock Purdy is healthy and will start against the Jaguars.

title: NFL HQ building shooter diagnosed with CTE
content: Shane Tamura, who killed four people and then himself in a July shooting at the NFL HQ building, was posthumously diagnosed with chronic traumatic encephalopathy, according to a statement from the New York City Officer of the Chief Medical Examiner.

title: Panthers star Barkov has surgery on ACL, MCL
content: Florida Panthers captain Aleksander Barkov is expected to miss seven to nine months after having surgery to address ACL and MCL injuries to his right knee, the team announced Friday.

title: Kane nets 100th Bayern goal; bests Haaland, CR7
content: Harry Kane reached 100 goals for Bayern Munich with his second strike against Werder Bremen on Friday, making European history in the process.

title: How Phoenix put top-seeded Minnesota on the brink of elimination
content: Lynx lost a contentious WNBA semifinals game in Phoenix, while Las Vegas pulled away to beat Indiana.

title: What happened on Day 1, and what it means for the rest of the Ryder Cup
content: Can Scottie Scheffler and Team USA turn things around? What can we expect from Saturday morning's matches. We breakdown the first day and look ahead to Day 2.

title: Everything left to play for during MLB's final weekend
content: There's still a lot at stake entering the final weekend of the regular season. We have your guide to the last few days of baseball before October.

title: Inside the Gundy-Oklahoma State divorce
content: After 20 years together, Gundy and the Pokes split. It was the culmination of a great run and internal strife.

title: 'This season he is better than ever': Haaland is becoming the complete striker for Man City
content: The goals are still flowing for Erling Haaland, but his growth as a leader and an all-around contributor has made him invaluable to Pep Guardiola and Manchester City.

title: Liverpool's Chiesa is 'here to win' and now has the chance to prove it
content: Federico Chiesa has struggled at times after moving to Liverpool, but he has a chance to reignite his career.

content: Seattle has never won a World Series. Or even an American League pennant. Could a little bit of magic change that?

content: Campbell was mocked for his introductory presser with the Lions. But players, execs and fans loved it -- and knew they had their guy.

content: Whether your team is headed to October or packing its bags for the offseason, how did 2025 measure up to expectations?

title: üèÄ Pearl steps down after 11 seasons at Auburn
content: Bruce Pearl has stepped down as the men's hoops coach at Auburn and will move into an ambassador's role in the athletic department as special assistant to the athletics director, the school announced Monday.

title: üèà Oklahoma St. fires longtime coach Mike Gundy
content: Oklahoma State, which has lost 11 of 12 games since the start of the 2024 season, has fired head coach Mike Gundy, who was in his 21st season with the Cowboys.

title: ‚ÜîÔ∏è Barnwell's fresh takes on 23 recent NFL trades
content: In March 2022, Seattle traded away Russell Wilson, altering the franchise's path. Let's reevaluate that move, plus 22 others from 2022-23.

content: Do injuries have you seeking a late-week pickup? Need a defense to stream? We have options with favorable setups.

content: Does Baker have Philly's number? Will the Giants rookie be a lineup lock going forward? Don't be surprised.

content: "We just building relationships," Parsons said of competing with his new teammates ahead of Sunday's return to Dallas.

title: Stanley Cup contender rankings: Who dethrones the Panthers, Oilers?
content: It's been the same Cup Final matchup in consecutive years. Here are the teams that can change that in 2025-26.

title: Ovi breaks another Gretzky record? Bold predictions for every NHL team
content: With opening night approaching on Oct. 7, we take big swings on what will transpire for each team this season.

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Mercury take 2-1 lead over Lynx, Aces up 2-1 over Fever
content: In the 2025 WNBA semifinals, Phoenix leads 1-seed Minnesota 2-1 while Las Vegas is up 2-1 over Indiana.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Can Reyes halt Ulberg's winning streak at UFC Fight Night?
content: Who has the edge at UFC Fight Night from Perth, Australia? MMA analysts and a betting insider make their picks.

title: Ranking boxing fights: Fundora-Thurman, Parker-Wardley, more
content: From Sebastian Fundora's title bout, to the junior middleweight debut of "Boots" Ennis, ESPN picks October's best fights.

title: Penn State RBs Nicholas Singleton and Kaytron Allen doing record things
content: Despite scouts placing the pair in the first two days of the NFL draft, they returned for one more year.

title: 'Our tradition to is to be untraditional': Inside the lifecycle of an Oregon uniform
content: Throughout the past two and a half decades, Oregon has pushed the envelope when it comes to uniforms.

title: College football best bets for Week 5: Why UK matches up well with South Carolina
content: Pamela Maldonado breaks down her favorite bets for Week 5 of the college football season, including what to expect when Kentucky heads to South Carolina.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona eye Dortmund's Guirassy as Lewandowski successor
content: Barcelona have added Borussia Dortmund striker Serhou Guirassy to their shortlist. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Ranking every World Cup mascot: From World Cup Willie to Maple, Zayu and Clutch
content: Now that the 2026 World Cup mascots have been revealed, ESPN ranks every competition's mascot from worst to first dating back to 1966.

title: Arizona State, West Virginia lead best uniforms from college football Week 5
content: Arizona State is going with all-black threads for its Friday night showdown, while West Virginia will don a look that throws things back all the way to 1965.

title: Chase Briscoe finally feeling like he belongs among NASCAR elite
content: Chase Briscoe is Cup Series winner, but always felt like he had something to prove. In his first year at Joe Gibbs Racing, he's doing just that.

title: Category league mock draft: Jokic or Wemby at No. 1?
content: Our 10-team, H2H category league mock draft included familiar faces a the top and Amen Thompson, Cade Cunningham and Tyrese Maxey all going in the top 25.

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: How Panthers line up without Barkov, Tkachuk
content: The Florida Panthers will be without both Aleksander Barkov and Matthew Tkachuk after Barkov suffered a knee injury.

title: 'If destroyed runways look ... ': India's sharp rebuttal to Shehbaz at UN; asks Pak to handover terrorists
content: India strongly countered Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif's UN remarks, where he claimed Pakistan downed Indian jets and praised Trump for a ceasefire. India's UN representative, Petal Gahlot, refuted this, stating "Operation Sindoor" was an Indian action against terrorists in Pakistan and that Pakistan had pleaded for a ceasefire after threatening more attacks.

title: 'You said he was operating from India...': Pak min contradicts self on Imran Khan
content: Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif faced scrutiny over contradictory claims about Imran Khan's Twitter, first stating he operated it from jail, then struggling to explain previous allegations of Indian control, citing unproven intelligence. He also affirmed China as Pakistan's reliable, long-standing ally and primary arms supplier.

title: Trump's 100% drug tariffs: Indian generics spared but pose risks for pharma sector
content: US President Trump announced a 100% tariff on imported branded and patented pharmaceuticals starting October 2025, aiming to boost domestic manufacturing. Indian generic drug makers are largely unaffected initially, but concerns loom over potential tariff expansion to complex generics. Sun Pharma faces significant exposure due to its US branded portfolio.

title: 'Miscreants will not be spared': CM Yogi's warning ahead of Dussehra
content: CM Yogi Adityanath has directed Uttar Pradesh authorities to take strict action against miscreants and ensure heightened security during the upcoming Dussehra celebrations. Police are instructed to identify troublemakers using video footage, especially after recent incidents, and maintain law and order, women's safety, and regulatory compliance. He also emphasized immediate arrests for rumour-mongers and vigilance against caste tensions.

title: Image of Jesus Christ replaced by Lord Krishna in Durga puja pandal
content: The image of Jesus Christ in a Vatican City-themed Durga Puja pandal in Ranchi was replaced with Lord Krishna's following objections from the Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP). The VHP alleged the original display hurt Hindu sentiments and encouraged conversion. Organizers stated the decision was made by committee members to promote religious harmony, not due to protests.

title: Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu challenges Microsoft: We offer better experience
content: Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu publicly challenged Microsoft, claiming Zoho offers a broader and superior product suite, asserting it's the only company capable of competing. This follows IT minister Ashwini Vaishnaw's adoption of Zoho's Swadeshi platform, urging others to embrace indigenous products. Vembu thanked the minister, boosting his team's morale.

title: Bangladesh‚Äôs mastermind once belonged to Pakistan ‚Äì now he‚Äôs laughing at their struggles
content: During Pakistan's nervy Super Four match against Bangladesh, former captain Rashid Latif sparked social media chatter with a pointed tweet about Mushtaq Ahmed's dual coaching roles. Pakistan ultimately secured an 11-run victory, defending 135, thanks to Shaheen Afridi and Haris Rauf's bowling.

title: 'Slapped, uniform torn': Delhi traffic cop assaulted by group for stopping helmetless duo
content: A traffic police sub-inspector was assaulted by a group of men in north Delhi after stopping them for a helmet check. Four individuals have been arrested, with two confessing to inciting the crowd by falsely alleging communal remarks. The officer sustained injuries, and police are searching for other suspects involved in the attack.

title: Accenture fired 11,000+ employees; CEO Julie Sweet warns, exit or upgrade
content: Accenture laid off over 11,000 employees globally in three months, citing rapid AI adoption and slowing corporate demand. These cuts are part of an $865 million restructuring, with more exits anticipated as the company aligns its workforce with AI-driven solutions and invests in agentic AI training. Despite the layoffs, Accenture reported a 7% revenue increase.

title: Google celebrates its 27th birthday with a touch of nostalgia
content: Google marked its 27th birthday on September 27, 2025, with a Google Doodle. The company started as a startup in 1998, founded by Larry Page and Sergey Brin. It developed into a technology leader. Its services, including Search and Maps, became part of life. The birthday celebration highlighted its journey and future innovations, including AI.

title: HC clears return: Russian woman in Gokarna cave allowed to go home; travel docs issued
content: The Karnataka High Court has allowed the central government to issue travel documents for an overstaying Russian woman, Nina Kutina, and her two minor daughters to return to Russia. The family was found living in an isolated cave near Gokarna.

title: Hyderabad floods: Himayat Sagar gates opened after heavy rains; Musi River overflows
content: Heavy rains in Hyderabad caused the Musi River to overflow near Chaderghat Bridge after Himayat Sagar gates opened, leading to road closures, traffic, and flooding. Chief Minister Revanth Reddy directed officials to remain on high alert, monitor flood-prone areas, and relocate residents, with emergency teams on standby for continued rain forecasts.

title: Top H‚Äë1B employers in 2025 : Amazon, Microsoft, Meta & others; check list
content: Amazon secured the most H-1B visa approvals in the first half of 2025, followed by TCS, Microsoft, Meta, and Apple. These tech giants utilize the program to employ skilled professionals in specialized roles.

title: '285 Bitcoins worth Rs 150cr': ED files chargesheet against Raj Kundra in Crypto scam
content: The Enforcement Directorate has charged businessman Raj Kundra, accusing him of being the beneficial owner of 285 Bitcoins, worth Rs 150.47 crore, received from crypto-scam mastermind Amit Bhardwaj. Kundra allegedly concealed evidence, failed to surrender the Bitcoins, and conducted a below-market transaction with his wife to disguise criminal proceeds, despite a mining deal not materializing.

title: Heartwarming! Suryakumar Yadav consoles Dunith Wellalage after tragic loss - watch
content: India captain Suryakumar Yadav offered heartfelt support to Sri Lanka's Dunith Wellalage, who recently lost his father, during the Asia Cup Super 4s. Despite his personal tragedy, Wellalage played, while India secured a thrilling Super Over victory against Sri Lanka, setting up a final clash with archrival Pakistan.

title: 'Incendiary actions': Why is US revoking Colombian president‚Äôs visa? All you need to know
content: The US will revoke Colombian President Gustavo Petro's visa after his controversial remarks at a New York pro-Palestine rally. Petro urged US soldiers to disobey orders and accused Donald Trump of Gaza "genocide complicity." He also called for a massive military response to the conflict, escalating US-Colombia tensions. Washington deemed his actions "reckless and incendiary."

title: Kirk‚Äôs past attacks on Taylor Swift resurface after his death
content: Following Charlie Kirk's death, his old derogatory post targeting Taylor Swift has resurfaced. In 2018, Kirk criticized Swift for endorsing a Democrat and questioning Marsha Blackburn's stance on women's issues. Swift had openly opposed Blackburn's views on LGBTQ+ rights and women's rights. The resurfaced post has drawn attention amid the controversy surrounding Kirk's assassination.

title: '18 accounts, 28 FD's': Court dismisses anticipatory bail plea of godman for fraud
content: A Delhi court denied anticipatory bail to Chaitanyananda Saraswati, alias Parthasarathy, who faces charges of cheating, forgery, and sexual harassment. The former institute director is accused of misappropriating funds, forging documents for two passports with differing identities, and fabricating records. Police froze Rs 8 crore as he remains at large, requiring custodial interrogation.

title: ‚ÄòFollowed into bathroom, recorded‚Äô: Trump official assaulted at UNGA
content: A Trump administration official faced a physical assault at the United Nations. The incident happened during the UN General Assembly. A "deranged leftist" reportedly attacked the Department of Health and Human Services official. The assailant followed the official into a bathroom. The person was arrested and later released. The US Secret Service will investigate security lapses.

title: 'No degree of drama can conceal facts': India responds to Pak PM's remarks at UN
content: India strongly rebutted Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif‚Äôs UN General Assembly address, labeling his remarks as "absurd theatrics" and accusing Pakistan of glorifying terrorism. Indian diplomat Petal Gahlot highlighted Pakistan's history of sheltering terrorists and its role in the Pahalgam attack. Sharif, conversely, accused India of unprovoked aggression, targeting civilians, and falsely claimed shooting down Indian jets.

title: 'For economic security': Trump admin mulls chip-based tariffs on foreign electronics
content: The Trump administration is reportedly planning new tariffs on imported electronics, based on their chip content, to boost US manufacturing. This move could impose a 25% rate on chip value, potentially raising costs for American consumers and worsening inflation. Major chipmakers like TSMC and Samsung might face significant impact, as the policy aims to reshore critical production.

title: Indian study permits in Canada drop 50%; implications for education sector & economy
content: Canada has seen a 50% decline in Indian study permit approvals in 2025, with projections suggesting a 67.5% drop from 2023. The number of new student arrivals and total permit holders has also decreased sharply. According to ICEF Monitor, this trend stems from stricter immigration policies, economic pressures, and rising global competition. The downturn could lead to a $10.5 billion shortfall in economic contributions, severely affecting Canadian education institutions and provincial economies.

title: 'I told him ...': Suryakumar opens up on why Arshdeep Singh bowled Super Over
content: India secured a thrilling Super Over victory against Sri Lanka in their final Asia Cup Super Four match, with captain Suryakumar Yadav praising Sanju Samson, Tilak Varma, and Arshdeep Singh's decisive bowling. Despite Pathum Nissanka's century for Sri Lanka, India remained unbeaten, advancing to the final after a high-scoring contest that went down to the wire.

title: Protests over ‚ÄòI Love Muhammad‚Äô posters turn violent in Bareilly; 50 detained
content: Bareilly witnessed violent protests after Friday prayers over 'I Love Muhammad' posters, as over 1,000 people pelted stones at police and vandalised vehicles. Police responded with lathi charge and tear gas, injuring ten cops. Fifty individuals, including IMC chief Maulana Tauqeer Raza Khan, were detained. The unrest, sparked by an FIR in Kanpur, led to similar demonstrations across other states.

title: High-speed crash in Gurgaon: Five killed as Thar flips after hitting divider
content: Five occupants, including three females, died when their black Thar crashed into a divider and overturned near Jharsa chowk in Gurgaon early Saturday morning. The driver reportedly lost control due to high speed while traveling from Delhi to Gurgaon. All victims were declared dead at a local hospital following the tragic accident.

title: 'Corrupt': Trump urges Microsoft to sack Lisa Monaco; calls her 'menace to US security'
content: US President Donald Trump publicly demanded Microsoft dismiss Lisa Monaco. He cited national security risks due to her past government roles. Monaco, a former Obama and Biden administration official, now leads Microsoft's global affairs. Trump linked his demand to legal cases against him. This action aligns with his pattern of targeting political adversaries and influencing corporate decisions.

title: Rajasthan horror: Newborn found with mouth glued, buried alive under stones in forest
content: Police in Bhilwara arrested an unmarried woman and her father for burying her 20-day-old newborn under stones with glue in his mouth to conceal an illegal birth. A shepherd discovered the infant, leading to a prompt police rescue and hospital admission.

title: Historic! Sanju Samson breaks Dhoni‚Äôs record for most T20I sixes
content: Sanju Samson has now become India's leading T20I wicketkeeper in terms of sixes, surpassing MS Dhoni's record with 55 maximums. Despite adapting to different batting positions, he showcased his destructive power, contributing a vital 39 runs against Sri Lanka. His consistent ability to clear boundaries and adaptability make him a crucial asset for India's upcoming Asia Cup final.

title: Johnny Manziel admits blowing his NFL shot with the Cleveland Browns
content: Johnny Manziel, once the celebrated Heisman-winning quarterback for Texas A&M and a Cleveland Browns first-round pick, saw his NFL career collapse due to off-field issues, substance abuse, and mental health struggles. Opening up in Untold and Special Forces, he reflects on lost opportunities, personal demons, and his ongoing journey to rebuild, finding solace in golf and self-improvement.

title: ‚ÄòWe have sharp eyes‚Äô: Gurgaon cop stalks digital creator using her car number
content: A Gurgaon police constable was suspended and an FIR registered after he used official channels to trace a 50-year-old digital creator's car registration. Finding her "attractive," he tracked her Instagram, commenting on her movements and admitting his identity, deeply disturbing the woman who later filed a complaint. Police took action after her video went viral.

title: All isn't well with how Sonam Wangchuk's career has gone
content: Sonam Wangchuk, the inspiration for the '3 Idiots' protagonist, has emerged as a prominent political activist for Ladakh. He has undertaken multiple hunger strikes, demanding statehood and Sixth Schedule protection for the region's indigenous people, citing concerns over resource exploitation post-Article 370 abrogation. His latest fast concluded after violent protests erupted across the region.

title: After Operation Sindoor, LeT moves deep into Pakistan
content: UN-designated terror outfit Lashkar-e-Taiba is relocating its operational and training infrastructure deeper into Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa to evade Indian strikes. Satellite imagery confirms a new facility, Markaz Jihad-e-Aqsa, is under construction in Lower Dir, 47km from the Afghan border, replacing a hub destroyed by the Indian Army. Key masterminds have been assigned leadership and instructional roles at this new site.

title: 'Go back to Pakistan': Hasina backers protest Bangladesh's Yunus at UN
content: Bangladesh's interim chief adviser Muhammad Yunus faced protests at the UNGA in New York, where Sheikh Hasina's supporters accused him of bias and poor governance. Critics allege his administration allowed attacks on minorities and strained ties with India by blaming them for hosting Hasina. Yunus addressed the UN on Bangladesh's post-uprising journey.

title: Asia Cup: Injury scare for India? Bowling coach shares updates on Abhishek Sharma, Pandya
content: India had an injury scare as Hardik Pandya and Abhishek Sharma left the field during the Sri Lanka clash, but bowling coach Morne Morkel confirmed both suffered only cramps. While Hardik will be reassessed before the Pakistan final, Abhishek is fit. Morkel admitted India haven‚Äôt played a ‚Äúcomplete game‚Äù yet and stressed sharper execution across departments.

title: Epstein files: Musk appears in newly released papers; possible island visit in 2014
content: Elon Musk's name appeared in the Jeffrey Epstein files. Other prominent figures like Prince Andrew and Peter Thiel are also mentioned. Democratic lawmakers released these documents. They show possible interactions between Epstein and these individuals. Musk may have visited Epstein's island in 2014. This was after Epstein was a registered sex offender. The revelations raise new questions.

title: 'Man of peace': At UNGA, Sharif backs Trump's claim of mediation
content: Pakistan's PM Shehbaz Sharif delivered a bizarre UN speech, falsely claiming victory over India and praising Trump for a ceasefire. Meanwhile, Trump's new 100% tariff on imported branded drugs has unsettled markets, raising concerns for India's $10bn pharma exports, especially if branded generics are included, prompting a search for new markets.

title: Who was Makena White? Star PGA Golfer Jake Knapp‚Äôs GF tragically dies at 28
content: Makena White, girlfriend of PGA golfer Jake Knapp, has died  earlier this week, at age 28. A beautiful person inside out, White lived  a life that was fulfilling. Described as having a "huge heart" and a "rare way of making you feel special," White was a devoted daughter, avid traveler, and dog lover. Her last social media post expressed deep love and pride for Knapp. Here's everything you need to know about Makena White.

title: India rejects as baseless Nato chief's claim PM Modi quizzed Putin on war
content: MEA strongly refuted Nato chief Mark Rutte's claims that PM Modi questioned Russian President Putin about his Ukraine strategy due to US tariffs. The MEA asserted no such conversation occurred, urging Nato for greater accuracy in public statements. India continues its discounted Russian oil imports, defending them as vital for national economic security.

title: Asia Cup: 'If anyone speaks against India, I will...'- Yograj Singh warns Pak ahead of final
content: Former India pacer Yograj Singh strongly condemned the on-field spat between Indian and Pakistani players during the Asia Cup Super Fours. He fiercely defended young Indian batters Abhishek Sharma and Shubman Gill, blaming Pakistan pacers for initiating verbal abuse. Singh's comments intensify the already charged rivalry ahead of the Asia Cup final.

title: Kai Trump shines at Ryder Cup 2025; walks with grandfather Donald Trump
content: President Donald Trump made a high-profile appearance at the 2025 Ryder Cup, joined by his 18-year-old granddaughter, Kai Trump. Their joint outing, from the White House to Bethpage Black, drew immense attention, highlighting Kai's rising golf profile and the family's deep ties to the sport. Trump also injected his trademark bravado.

title: Travis Kelce rumoured to star in Taylor Swift‚Äôs 'The Fate of Ophelia' video
content: Taylor Swift fans are speculating Travis Kelce will appear in her "The Fate of Ophelia" music video, fueled by a lip-read comment from a behind-the-scenes clip. Theories suggest Swift wants "him" in the video, potentially rewriting Ophelia's tragic story to incorporate her real-life romance. The highly anticipated video premieres October 3.

title: Gisele B√ºndchen reveals why she left Leonardo DiCaprio after years together
content: Gisele Bundchen, post-divorce from Tom Brady, reflects on her past high-profile relationship with Leonardo DiCaprio, revealing it ended due to differing life paths. She also recalls meeting Brady, whom she married in 2009 before their 2022 divorce. Bundchen now lives a comfortable life with her new boyfriend, Joaquim Valente.

title: Evans steals the show; Vaquer-Stratton set for Crown Jewel
content: "SmackDown" set up a major match for the crown jewel event in Perth, Australia . Tiffany Stratton retained her WWE Women's Championship on Friday . the story of Friday night was a save, surprise and an incredible showing by one of the most talented wrestlers in the roster .

title: 'That's Guard ball': Inside the chaotic approach that has fueled the Guardians' epic rise
content: the inning came in the bottom of the sixth in the opening game of a crucial series between the Cleveland Guardians and Detroit Tigers . the two rivals had been going in opposite directions for the better part of the month . all-world pitcher Tarik Skubal was nursing a 2-0 lead, meaning the end of the Tigers were just a few innings away .

title: Packers-Cowboys rivalry rewind: From the Ice Bowl to Micah Parsons' Dallas return
content: the history between the Green Bay Packers and Dallas Cowboys runs deep . ex-teammate Micah Parsons won't be last Todd Archer and Dan Graziano . his biggest meetings are loaded with potential future Hall of Famers .

title: 15 more NFL Week 4 games, 15 matchup previews: We have predictions, picks and wild stats
content: the "Get Up" crew debates which team, the Ravens or the Chiefs, is under pressure to get a win ahead of their game Sunday . quarterback quarterback Jaxson Dart will make his debut against the surging Chargers . the 1-2 teams will face off in an AFC showdown .

title: The real reason Mike Gundy got dumped
content: Dabo Swinney: "you have to constantly reinvent, reinvest, reset, learn, grow. You change" the business of college football in 2025 is different from 2015. Direct revenue-sharing, NIL and the transfer portal have altered the way rosters are assembled .

title: MLB insiders predict the playoffs: Bold takes, dangerous teams and breakout stars
content: the new york Yankees and los Angeles Dodgers are scouts raving about . the Seattle Mariners are 49 years into their existence . they've yet to make a World Series, but they haven't made a series .

title: NBA Rank 2025: What league insiders say about the top 100
content: a preseason poll naming Nikola Jokic the best player in the NBA . we reached out to scouts, coaches and executives across the league to get their feedback on our new top 100 for 2025-26 . some of the biggest questions and points of contention from our latest edition of NBA Rank .

title: Musk named in newly released Epstein files. Tesla boss issues three word response
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, providing a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers .

title: Everything you need to know about Oregon-Penn State, Bama-Georgia and a blockbuster Week 5
content: the Crimson Tide travel to Georgia on friday night . it's the first trip to athens, Georgia, in a decade . resurgent Florida State visits a wonderfully surprising Virginia team . last week's merciless blowout of Illinois, Indiana hailed a harrowing victory .

title: üìà NBA Rank: Top 100 players for 2025-26
content: the "NBA Today" crew discusses a preseason poll naming Nikola Jokic the best player in the NBA . our 2025 NBA Rank wraps up as we break down the final top 10 players in the league . we asked our expert panel to vote on player vs. player matchups .

title: Derrick Henry falls, Penei Sewell rises in latest Madden NFL 26 ratings
content: the third week of Madden ratings is in . every week a round of updates to all of the player ratings . this week the bigger winners are the Kansas City Chiefs long snapper James Winchester and Washington Commanders offensive lineman Chris Paul .

title: Ryder Cup 2025 best moments: U.S. trails Europe after Day 1
content: team Europe fielded Rory McIlroy, Robert MacIntyre, Tommy Fleetwood, Justin Rose, Rasmus Hjgaard and Tyrrell Hatto . team Europe finished day 1 with a three-point lead -- 5.5 to 2.5 .

title: Why Daniel Jones has flourished in Indy, and what could still derail his season
content: Daniel Jones is off to an excellent start in his first season with the Indianapolis Colts . he's the only player in the past 90 years with at least three rushing touchdowns, three passing touchdowns and no turnovers over the first three games of a season . Jones is the league leader in Total QBR (85.8) .

title: Trump Mulls Tariffs On Foreign Electronics Based On Number Of Chips: Reports
content: The Trump administration is considering imposing tariffs on foreign electronic devices based on the number of chips in each device, according to three people familiar with the matter, as it seeks to drive companies to shift their manufacturing to US.

title: Man Lynched In Madhya Pradesh For Entering House, Killing 3-Year-Old
content: A man was lynched after he allegedly hacked to death a 3-year-old boy in Dhar district in Madhya Pradesh, a police official said on Friday.

title: Wall Street To Academia, Who Is In Trump's Line Of Fire
content: US President Donald Trump has escalated his criticism and actions against executives, corporations and institutions. His unprecedented actions - from novel export deals to frozen university grants - have upended the status quo between the government,

title: 5 Dead As Speeding Thar Loses Control, Hits Divider On Gurugram Highway
content: Five people died and one was left severely injured after a speeding Thar they were in lost control and crashed into a divider on the National Highway in Gurugram on Saturday morning.

title: "Will I Kiss Her?" Row Deepens After Madhya Pradesh Minister's Remark On Rahul-Priyanka Gandhi Bond
content: The controversy over Madhya Pradesh Minister Kailash Vijayvargiya's remarks targeting Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi's bond with his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has now deepened, with his cabinet colleague Vijay Shah openly backing him.

title: Google Turns 27: Birthday Doodle Brings Back Its "First-Ever" 1998 Logo
content: Google is marking its 27th birthday with a special throwback on its homepage, offering a glimpse of where it all began.

title: Zubeen Garg's Manager, Festival Organiser Summoned For Questioning: Sources
content: The Special Investigation Team (SIT) probing the death of Zubeen Garg has issued summons to Shyamkanu Mahanta, who organised the Northeast India Festival in Singapore, and the singer's manager, Siddhartha Sarma, to join the investigation by October 6

title: UP Cleric Detained After His 'I Love Muhammad' Video Sparks Massive Protest
content: Tauqeer Raza, a local cleric and chief of Ittehad-e-Millat Council, whose call for protest supporting the 'I love Muhammad' campaign led to chaos in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly, was detained on Saturday.

title: Maoist Couple With Rs 13 Lakh Bounty Arrested In Chhattisgarh
content: During the raid, sleuths uncovered shocking evidence of their covert operations. From their rented accommodation, police seized a 10-gram gold biscuit, Rs 1.14 lakh in cash, two Android smartphones, and other incriminating materials.

title: 'Return In 4 Weeks': Calcutta High Court Calls Bangladesh Deportation Of Bengal Residents "Illegal"
content: The Calcutta High Court on Friday set aside the Centre's decision to deport Sonali Bibi and Sweety Bibi, residents of Birbhum district in West Bengal, along with their families to Bangladesh after terming them as "illegal immigrants".

title: Mother Detained Days After Baby Found Abandoned In Forest With Lips Glued
content: Days after a newborn was found abandoned in a forest in Rajasthan's Bhilwara, with his lips sealed with glue and a stone inside, the police have detained the baby's mother and maternal grandfather.

title: In A First, Polish Man Skis Down Mount Everest Without Oxygen Tank
content: Poland's Andrzej Bargiel has become the first person to ski down Mount Everest without an oxygen tank, his team said on Thursday.

title: 55 Evacuated As Hyderabad's Musi River Swells After Heavy Rainfall
content: At least 55 people from flood-prone localities in Hyderabad were evacuated as the inflow in the Musi River increased after heavy rainfall in the city.

title: "Destroyed Runways Look Like Victory?" India Mocks Shehbaz Sharif's Claim
content: India on Saturday called out the "absurd theatrics" of Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif for "once again glorifying terrorism" at the United Nations General Assembly.

title: What India Said On Proposed Changes To H-1B Visa Selection Process
content: The government is aware of the one-month public comment period before the final rules are drafted for overhauling the H-1B visa lottery system, the Foreign Ministry has said.

title: US Government Shutdown Looms: How It Could Unfold
content: The threat of a government shutdown has become a recurring event in Washington, though most of the time lawmakers and the president are able to head it off.

title: 4 Officials, 2 Workers Dead As Roof Collapses At Chhattisgarh Steel Plant
content: Four officials and two workers were killed in an accident inside a furnace at a private steel plant in Chhattisgarh's capital Raipur on Friday, while six others, including a general manager, sustained injuries, police said.

title: Nirav Modi's Brother-In-Law Turns Approver In PNB Case, Pardoned By Court
content: A special court has granted Maiank Mehta, brother-in-law of businessman Nirav Modi, a pardon in the case linked to the multi-million dollar Punjab National Bank (PNB) scam, making him an approver.

title: UP Headmaster Who Attacked Education Officer Was "Harassed": Minister
content: Uttar Pradesh's Minister of Technical Education Ashish Patel on Friday termed a recent Sitapur assault incident extremely unfortunate.

title: Acid Attack, A Married Woman's Multiple Identities, And A Game Of Deception
content: A man has been arrested following an encounter for allegedly throwing acid on a teacher here, police said on Friday.

title: Who is Petal Gahlot? Indian diplomat who took on Shahbaz Sharif at UN
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: At least five killed, one injured after speeding Thar collides with divider on Delhi-Gurugram Expressway
content: Five people, including three women and two men, died on the spot, while one man was critically injured and admitted to a private hospital

title: Curfew remains in force in Leh, patrolling intensified amid uneasy calm after Sonam Wangchuk‚Äôs arrest
content: Lt. Governor Kavinder Gupta is shortly chairing a high-level security review meeting at Raj Bhavan, and any decision to relax curfew will be taken accordingly

title: Waqf Board not to be reconstituted until Supreme Court pronounces final verdict: T.N. Minister
content: Mr. Nasar assured that the Waqf Board would not be reconstituted in Tamil Nadu as per the amended Act, which he claimed was hastily implemented by the Centre, until the Supreme Court pronounces its final verdict.

title: PM Modi reaches Odisha‚Äôs Jharsuguda to unveil projects worth ‚Çπ60,000 cr
content: This is the PM's sixth visit to the state in 15 months since the BJP came to power in Odisha in June 2024

title: ‚ÄòBabbar Khalsa International terrorist Pindi extradited from Abu Dhabi to India,‚Äô says Punjab DGP
content: Pindi is a close aide of foreign-based terrorists Harwinder Singh alias Rinda and Happy Passia and is involved in multiple heinous crimes

title: Traffic restrictions for Bathukamma festival at Hyderabad‚Äôs Tank Bund on September 27; congestion likely at major junctions
content: Congestion is likely at major junctions including Khairatabad, Iqbal Minar, Liberty, Ravindra Bharati, Necklace Rotary, Tank Bund, Ranigunj and Nallagutta

title: Eknath Shinde announces comprehensive development plan for Maharashtra‚Äôs Thane district
content: Eknath Shinde said MMRDA will appoint an expert committee to study traffic congestion across the Mumbai Metropolitan Region and propose a permanent solution

title: ‚ÄòChances of infiltration high along LoC before snowfall, security on high alert‚Äô: BSF Kashmir IG
content: IG Ashok Yadav said there is a presence of terrorists on the launch pads across the LoC opposite the AOR (area of responsibility) in the Bandipora and Kupwara sectors.

title: Hagrama Mohilary‚Äôs Bodoland People‚Äôs Front registers landslide victory in Bodoland Territorial Council elections
content: The Bodoland People's Front (BPF) improved its tally from the 17 seats it had won last time and secured an absolute majority

title: NIA attaches immovable properties of terror operative in Kashmir
content: On the orders of the NIA special court in Jammu, the agency attached immovable properties of Tariq Ahmad Mir, a chargesheeted accused who was arrested in April in a terror-related case.

title: Ahead of PM Modi's visit, heavy rainfall continues in Odisha as depression crosses coastal areas
content: Initially, the place for the PM's public meeting was fixed at Berhampur in Ganjam district in the southern part of the State, but it was later changed to Jharsuguda due to a forecast of heavy rain in that region

title: IMD predicts heavy showers in Mumbai, suburbs; orange alert issued
content: The traffic on the city roads is normal, while the local train services are operating with some delays

title: Rahul Gandhi embarks on four-nation South America visit
content: According to the Congress, Mr. Gandhi will visit Brazil and Colombia, where he is expected to interact with university students

title: Two militants involved in Sept. 19 ambush on Assam Rifles convoy in Manipur arrested
content: One of the two militants was picked up from Assam's Guwahati, but the police did not disclose the location where the other was arrested

title: Madras High Court upholds Tamil Nadu government‚Äôs new mini bus scheme
content: Justice N. Mala says, the scheme warrants judicial affirmation since it was intended at ensuring last mile connectivity by reaching areas that remain unserved even after 78 years of Independence

title: Pakistani military pleaded for cessation of fighting during Operation Sindoor: India exercises Right of Reply at UNGA
content: Ms. Gahlot said in the UNGA hall that ‚Äúwe saw many pictures of terrorists slain in Bahawalpur and Muridke terror complexes by Indian forces during Operation Sindoor‚Äù

title: High Court seeks instructions on NDPS special courts
content: The court was hearing a batch of petitions, including by Ernakulam native Sumi Joseph, the mother of two school-going children, seeking effective measures by the State government to curb the use of narcotic.

title: GCDA to hand over Kaloor stadium to SKF for preparations ahead of Argentina‚Äôs match
content: SKF will carry out the necessary infrastructure upgrades based on a detailed plan. Traders operating in the shops surrounding the stadium will need to be temporarily relocated or shut down, says GCDA

title: Rains LIVE: Heavy rains batter Marathwada; villages cut off, roads flooded
content: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has forecast ‚Äúheavy rain and thunderstorms with lightning‚Äù in parts of Andhra Pradesh until October 2

title: Engaged with Trump administration, other stakeholders: India on H-1B visa fee hike
content: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) said the mobility of skilled talent has contributed enormously to innovation, economic growth and wealth creation in both the U.S. and India

title: JJP¬†criticises Haryana govt. for income limit in new scheme¬†for women
content: The BJP during the election had promised ‚Çπ2,100 monthly financial assistance¬†under the scheme¬†to all women, says party‚Äôs youth wing State president Digvijay Chautala

title: J&K L-G Manoj Sinha announces re-opening of 12 tourist spots closed after Pahalgam attack
content: An official¬†said out of 12 tourist spots thrown open, five are in the Jammu division and seven in the Kashmir division.

title: Every penny of Rangla Punjab to be used for flood-hit people: CM Mann
content: CM Mann noted that contributions through Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) could not be made to the Chief Minister's Relief Fund, and even Members of Parliament can donate a maximum of 20 lakh to it.

title: Giving warriors a fighting chance: Where personnel injured in line of duty are trained to become para-athletes and IT professionals
content: In 2020, the National Centre for Divyang Empowerment was established as an exclusive facility for training CAPF personnel who suffer injuries and become physically challenged in the line of duty. In five years, the centre has trained 219 ‚ÄòDivyang warriors‚Äô, producing medal-winning para-athletes and IT professionals. Vijaita Singh and Naveen Kumar report on how the facilities on campus give the injured a new lease of life

title: Two Kerala students allege assault by Delhi police personnel
content: Denying allegations of theft, they say police officers brutally assaulted them, forced them to speak in Hindi and ridiculed them for wearing lungi; MP John Brittas seeks impartial probe into ‚Äòcustodial brutality‚Äô

title: DRDO wins businessline‚Äôs Changemaker of the Year Award for its strategic technology
content: The Azim Premji Foundation won the Iconic Changemaker Award for its pioneering and extensive work in education and healthcare

title: CBI coordinates return of UAPA accused from UAE
content: Parminder Singh was wanted by the Punjab police in a case of alleged extortion, raising funds for terrorist acts, attempt to murder and criminal intimidation

title: Sonam Wangchuk detained under NSA & shifted to Jodhpur: Ladakh administration
content: Time and again, it has been observed that Wangchuk has been indulging in activities prejudicial to the security of the state and detrimental to maintenance of peace and public order and services essential to the community, the Directorate of Information & Public Relations (DIPR), Ladakh said in a statement here.

title: Punjab Ministers blame Centre of ‚Äòstep-motherly‚Äô attitude towards Punjab; Congress demands probe on floods
content: What‚Äôs even more troubling is the Prime Minister‚Äôs announcement of a paltry ‚Çπ1600 crore relief package, of which not a single rupee has been disbursed to Punjab to date, says Punjab Finance Minister Harpal Singh Cheema

title: New farming technology holds potential to stop desertification
content: The researchers have essentially carried out modification of desert sand into soil using polymers for reaping its full agricultural potential

title: Roger Staubach surprises Brian Schottenheimer at news conference
content: cowboys quarterback dak Prescott weighs in on former teammate miach Parsons . 83-year-old was inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame in 1985 . Staubach won two Super Bowls with the Cowboys in the 1970s .

title: News: Red Sox, Guardians look to lock down playoff berths
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . the final series for all MLB teams begins today, with several playoff questions still needing to be answered . a win over the Detroit Tigers or a loss to the los Angeles Angels can clinch a playoff spot today .

title: 'Action against terror networks': NIA attaches properties of Hizbul operative in Kashmir

title: Stalin inaugurates civic amenities set up at cost of ‚Çπ41.83 crore
content: The projects include upgraded sports facilities at Bharathidasan Stadium in Shenoy Nagar and amenities at parks in Koyambedu and Ramapuram

title: CEO of Hong Kong firm alleges ‚Çπ15-crore cargo fraud
content: B. Subramanyan says the Container Freight Station in Vallur near Kattupalli Port unlawfully released his company goods to the importers without the original bills of lading or valid Delivery Orders; he alleges that his subsequent inquiries had revealed a larger conspiracy involving 21 individuals, including representatives of the import firms, shipping companies, and officials of the freight station

title: R. Venkataramani re-appointed as Attorney General
content: The President is pleased to re-appoint Shri R Venkataramani, Senior Advocate, as Attorney General for India for a further period of two years with effect from 01.10.2025, a notification read.

title: Renovation of open-air auditorium begins at Cusat
content: The structural changes will be implemented as per the recommendations made by a four-member technical committee appointed by the Syndicate after the tragic stampede that occurred on November 25, 2023

title: Police said Sonam Wangchuk was being taken to Jodhpur, says wife
content: Gitanjali Angmo said she was yet to receive a copy of the formal detention order. ‚ÄúWe will prepare the legal response once we get a copy of the order,‚Äù she said. Ladakh Buddhist Association president Cherring Dorjay Lakruk pledges legal support for Sonam Wangchuk.

title: NISAR satellite sends first radar images of Earth‚Äôs surface
content: The images display details with which NISAR scans Earth to provide unique, actionable information to decision-makers in a diverse range of areas

title: BPF leads in Assam‚Äôs Bodoland council polls
content: The party was leading in 21 of the autonomous council‚Äôs 40 seats, more than 12 hours after the counting of votes began at 8 a.m. on Friday. The UPPL and ally-turned-rival BJP are set to win almost as many seats as in the 2020 polls.

title: Congress slams detention of Ladakh activist Sonam Wangchuk, demands judicial probe into violence that left four youth dead
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh says detention was meant to divert attention from BJP‚Äôs failure to ensure security, Sixth Schedule status in Ladakh; Congress Ladakh chief slams ‚Äúpolice firing‚Äù against protestors

title: Zubeen Garg death: Women‚Äôs ODI World Cup opening ceremony toned down
content: BCCI is consciously moving marquee cricket matches out of tier 1 cities to attract more girls to cricket, Secretary Devajit Saikia says

title: Science Ministry survey on R&D in India gets weak response from private sector
content: The latest edition of the survey was launched in December 2024 with firms given time until September 30, 2025 to submit responses; the deadline may be extended now

title: AAP attacks BJP over Sonam Wangchuk‚Äôs detention
content: Drawing parallels to Ravana, Hitler, and Mussolini, AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal responds to activist‚Äôs detention by warning of the downfall of ‚Äúthose who practice dictatorship and arrogance‚Äù

title: Bareilly tense as police personnel and protesters clash over poster row
content: The protest was against the police FIR against people who carried ‚ÄòI Love Muhammed‚Äô posters at a Kanpur procession on September 4

title: Tile-by-tile restoration brings back the lost splendour of Paigah Tombs in Hyderabad
content: After decades of neglect, destruction, and encroachment, the tombs are now being restored by the State government and the Aga Khan Trust for Culture, with funding from the U.S. State Department‚Äôs Ambassadors Fund for Cultural Preservation

title: QuantM: A game-changer for milk safety and farmer livelihoods
content: What makes the innovation even more powerful is its integration with NIAB‚Äôs rapid antimicrobial sensitivity kit, as a result the two tests can confirm both the presence of mastitis and the most effective treatment within two hours ‚Äî a process that typically takes two to three days in conventional labs

title: Recall Char Dham project judgment: Murli Manohar Joshi, environmentalists to Supreme Court
content: Environmentalists have argued that cutting hill slopes and the resulting debris are damaging to the eco-system and worsen the impact of landslides and torrential rains as well as cause massive roadblocks and pile-up on these mountain roads.

content: Delivering his inaugural address at the 16th edition of graVITas, Mr. Mansoori said that students should be creative and compassionate thinkers to achieve a balance between progress and sustainability in their career.

content: Most of the councillors highlighted the need to conduct monthly council meetings as against the existing practice of once in three or four months as such an arrangement will allow them to air public grievances regularly.
